section.title: Sending messages to a remote logserver using the RFC3164 protocol
section.para: The network() destination driver can send syslog messages conforming to RFC3164 from the network using the TCP, TLS, and UDP networking protocols.

The RLTP protocol can be used as well, but only when the new format of the network() destination driver when setting up a destination. The old format is still in use, however, it is advised to use the new format if you intend to use the RLTP protocol. For details about the RLTP protocol, see . In the following examples the old and the new format is described.

section.title: network() destination options
section.para: The network() driver sends messages to a remote host (for example a syslog-ng server or relay) on the local intranet or internet using the RFC3164 syslog protocol (for details about the protocol, see ). The network() driver supports sending messages using the UDP, TCP, RLTP or the encrypted TLS networking protocols.
